definition: respectful submission or yielding to the judgment of another
sentence: In deference to her experience, they accepted her recommendations.

definition: the ability to understand and share the feelings of another
sentence: Her empathy towards the victims of the disaster was palpable.

definition: not having any serious purpose or value
sentence: He was criticized for spending money on frivolous items.
The incessant noise from the construction site was unbearable.

definition: a commotion or fuss, especially one caused by conflicting views
sentence: There was a kerfuffle over the seating arrangements at the event.

definition: producing a great deal of profit
sentence: She found a lucrative job in the tech industry.

definition: not aware of or concerned about what is happening
sentence: She was oblivious to the chaos around her.
He gave a plausible explanation for his absence.

definition: unnecessary, especially through being more than enough
sentence: The report was filled with superfluous details that confused the issue.

definition: tending to keep a firm hold of something
sentence: Her tenacious spirit helped her overcome many obstacles.
